solution_line_template: The quilt is made of {squares_one_side} squares on one side and {squares_other_side} on the other so {squares_one_side}+{squares_other_side} = <<{squares_one_side}+{squares_other_side}={total_squares}>>{total_squares} squares total

She has already sewn {percent_sewn_num}% of the quilt so she has sown together {percent_sewn_decimal}*{total_squares} = <<{percent_sewn_num}*{percent_factor}*{total_squares}={squares_sewn}>>{squares_sewn} squares
Betsy still has {total_squares}-{squares_sewn} = <<{total_squares}-{squares_sewn}={remaining_squares}>>{remaining_squares} more squares to sew together
